job title: Specialist Process Improvement Analyst - IT Data Analyst
job description:
TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP (TSG) is the central infrastructure services group
with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers
have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the financial services
market place. BNY Mellon App Engine technology is leading edge with industry
first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined with enterprise standards
for developers.

'

TSG
is building next generation scalable, efficient data center as a service using
the latest innovation infrastructure. Building on top of the cloud deployments
in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively automating and bridging the green field
cloud with the existing virtual computing environments.

'

The Hardware Asset Management team is
responsible for the tools and processes that support tracking the firm's IT
fleet globally. We work collaboratively within the team and with stakeholders
and clients to manage and maintain the tools and data, identifying changes and
enhancements to improve our processes with the goal to maintain the highest
possible accuracy in our data. We interact with staff across the globe, we
interact with multiple vendors for product support and provide a variety of
data, process and application analysis.

'

Key responsibilities include:

Create and maintain data queries
across multiple DBMS system types, understanding and documenting data models as
needed.
Analyzing data from a variety of internal sources,
communicate results succinctly and drive resolution of discrepancies.
Establishing and adjusting data cleansing rules to
reduce error rates and increase data accuracy.
Designing, developing and maintaining enterprise
level data analysis and reporting solutions.
Documenting business and technical requirements,
capturing process flows and outlining application procedures.
Interacting with system users on issues and
enhancements and troubleshooting failures to resolution.
Providing basic application
configuration and operational support to internal clients.
Developing insights on proposed changes
and improvements to better manage inventory.

'

Specialist Process Improvement
Analyst->> Leads a wide array of activities supporting the improvement of
processes and procedures. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project.
Provides project/process management consulting, coaching, and training to IT
teams and/or Project/Process Office staff across one or more LOBs. Provides
input on approaches/tools to build, streamline, implement, and/or automate key
processes. Promotes the company's project management methodology, tools and
techniques. Develops and may manage IT processes and work flows which maximize
efficiency, and comply with regulatory and audit requirements. Helps assess
gaps in the processes used within one or more LOBs. Participates in formal
assessments and checkpoints for one or more LOBs. May develop and manage the
project plans to support process improvement or IT projects at the LOB level.
Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables. Builds
effective working relationships with peers and clients. Manages client
partnerships to ensure that service expectations are developed and met.
Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a related
discipline or equivalent education and work experience is required.'
Three to Five (3-5) years of
experience in systems and data management is preferred.
Experience in the securities or
financial services industry is a plus.
Strong
background in relational data concepts, with an emphasis on the use of analytic
and reporting tools.
Critical
thinking and analytical skills to solve problems and effectively communicate
solutions.
Programming
experience and expertise across a number of languages and frameworks.
A willingness to learn new
technologies in a team environment is required.

For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart.
